reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book very much. It will start drawing you in from the start and not let up till the end. The writing is outstanding! I loved the overall story. This author knows how to write an intriguing story. This guy has been kidnapping young girls for over twenty five years! How has he not been caught? Brandon Hall is on the case even though he is not a police officer. He will do his best to get results. This case is not easy to solve.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great book! Lots of twists and turns!
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to give this book 5 stars, but I’m a sucker for a happy ending and hate when things aren’t completely resolved in the story.There were a lot of shocks, twists, and turns, and this kept me engrossed from first page to last, which is a good thing, because if I don’t, like the story or the characters the book, like the story or the characters the book goes into my did not finish file.There were some miscellaneous characters who really did not add anything to the story, I felt the character descriptions could be a little bit better, and there was just a little bit too much focus on the heroine and her frequent meltdowns. I not saying the meltdowns weren’t valid, but just a little bit too frequent and they distracted from the story.The reason for the four stars, there was an aspect of the story that was not resolved, written off in the epilogue with just two sentences, and I felt that tangent needed more development. It was a critical part of the story, in my opinion, and yet it was brushed off and not resolved. The only reason for that I can think is the author intends to use that aspect as the plot for another story, so I guess we’ll have to see.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An emotional roller coaster of horror
reviews.reviewText: I accidentally picked this book for my book of the month, but didn’t want to waste the pick so I blindly started reading, didn’t read the description or look anything else up about this book, genuinely went in completely blind. I haven’t put it down for 6 hours and just finished it. As a mother this was definitely a hard read but the ending makes the pain all worth it. This book was so amazing i was seriously on edge and anxious the entire read. Such a pleasant surprise. 10/10 recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I made it to 65%
reviews.reviewText: This book is so far-fetched, and the characters are dumb. I tried really hard to read it to the end, but I just can't slog on!! SPOILER ALERT!!First, when the "doctor" Olivia decided to take the abused child into her home, she ignored advice to get an alarm system. This makes ZERO sense when she had lost her own daughter years before!! And she's constantly falling asleep at odd hours of the day - why??!!! When the ex-cop Brandon heard directly from the girl about the horrors she had endured, not only did he leave the girl and Olivia (his ex-wife) alone at home (despite the fact that the ex-wife told him she thought she had seen someone outside), but he did NOT tell the cops what he found out!! I just can't keep going. Another free monthly read wasted, although maybe all the options were as bad?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Thriller with Heart
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed reading this, so much so I woke up at 3:30am (when my alarm was set for 6:00am) and decided to delve in and lose sleep over it. I really wanted to find out what happened to Delilah and to make sure that she was ok, after all she went through.I enjoyed the character development for the most part, though I did want some closure with Lisa. I also found the ending a bit anticlimactic. I think that’s because the villain wasn’t as fleshed out as I would like, and because Olivia seemed distant from all the goings-on. There is a lot of “tell” more than “show” in this book, which gives the impression that it could be shortened. The romance felt unauthentic at times.I feel that the author does have great potential, however, just needs a bit more polish. She really does well with capturing the reader’s heart.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: WOW, what a story, what a book! I couldn't put this down! This story pulled me in with each page and chapter. You feel each emotion and tears as you are pulled into the story. Well done Angela, I haven't read a book this good in a long time. 😁

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For an Amazon first reads this may be my favorite
reviews.reviewText: I read a lot and enjoy some of my Amazon “free reads” but the of all so far I would say this is my absolute favorite. It sucked me in within the first few pages and I either didn’t want to put it down at night or couldn’t wait to start it again the next day. I will for sure be following this author for anything new she has!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Page turner but also pretty "out there"
reviews.reviewText: This book sucks you in quickly and keeps you hooked, although some parts are a little too far fetched even for fiction.The writing is quirky and a little campy at times but it doesn't detract too much from the book.
I got this book through Amazon First Reads. It was fantastic! I just wanted to keep reading it. It had me hooked from the very beginning.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Excellent read, I would highly recommend. Had me gripped and wanting to find answers and find out who it is all connected. Great read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Couldn't put it down but disappointed with the last chapter. Needed more info on the aftermath. Who were the Family,what did happen to the girls that were married off what did happen to the babies. Left so many questions unanswered.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Finally, a first reads freebie that's finally worth it. Suspense, intrigue, and an ending that makes it all come together.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved the plot, loved the characters. Would like to read more from this author.
